TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Agent , ORG and Law Enforcement .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE regulatory offence proceedings were instituted against the applicant , because his dog had bitten Mr H. On DATE he was fined on account of the regulatory offence of ‘ endangering with a dog’ ( kutyával való veszélyeztetés ) . On the applicant ’s objection , the case was forwarded to ORG . The court ordered that the principal decision be reviewed . As a result , on DATE the court changed the decision and fined the applicant a lesser amount on account of the regulatory offence of having walked his dog without a leash . This decision was declared final on DATE .
On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant , in the context of the same incident , for ‘ not having assisted the victim’ in respect of the danger caused by him .

DATE and DATE , ORG held CARDINAL hearings and obtained the opinion of an expert . On DATE it acquitted the applicant for want of evidence . The public prosecutor ’s office appealed but withdrew its appeal on DATE .
The applicant ’s appeal , pleading the absence of a crime , was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
In the meantime , the applicant ’s criminal accusations against an interrogator involved in the above proceedings were to no avail and were finally rejected by ORG on DATE .
